alert.note: Alert for Hall; Hamilton; Merrick; Nance; Polk (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Ice Storm Warning issued January 03 at 2:42AM CST until January 03 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...ICE STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Significant icing. Snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches on top of total ice accumulations of two to four tenths. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Nance, Merrick, Polk, Hall and Hamilton Counties. * WHEN...Until noon CST today. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be nearly impossible. Patchy blowing snow on Tuesday could reduce visibility as well. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Freezing rain and sleet will gradually transition to light to moderate snow early this morning. The highest snow amounts will be from Cairo to Fullerton and points north from there. While additional significant ice accumulations are not likely beyond 5am, the combination of snow falling on top of already accumulated ice will make for extremely hazardous travel conditions. Also, persistent gusty northwest winds through all of today will likely cause power outages.
info.instruction: Travel is strongly discouraged. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible power outages. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
